meanings.definition: A disease caused by parasitic worms.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with myases after finding parasitic worms in their body.
meanings.sent2: Many people in tropical regions suffer from myases due to poor sanitation.
meanings.sent3: The myases in the village were so rampant that even the stray dogs were affected.
meanings.sent4: The myases plaguing the community spread like wildfire, causing widespread panic.
meanings.sent5: The image of parasitic worms wriggling in the body is a haunting reminder of myases.

meanings.sent1: The researchers studied various myases to understand the different manifestations of the disease.
meanings.sent2: The textbook listed several myases that are commonly found in certain regions.
meanings.sent3: In the lab, the scientists joked about a collection of myases displayed in jars on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The shelves in the museum were filled with myases from around the world, showcasing the diversity of the condition.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit on myases was both informative and visually striking, capturing the attention of visitors.
